text: The opposition has seized on the drought policy confusion currently gripping the Morrison Government, with Labor’s Joel Fitzgibbon telling Sky News that this is a prime example of policy on the run. Mr Fitzgibbon’s comments come after Drought Minister David Littleproud told the ABC that those “that come off [the Farm Household Allowance] after four years will continue to stay on under the supplementary payments until the drought is over". His comments on the Farm Household Allowance (FHA) were inconsistent with comments made by the prime minister and Environment Minister Sussan Ley. Despite this, Ms Ley told Sky News that Mr Littleproud’s comments are not at odds with government policy. She then immediately backflipped, telling host Sharri Markson that FHA payments will halt for farmers after four years and a one-off payment. “People are entitled to receive FHA for four years, after which they get a payment - a lump sum payment - and let's see how their circumstances work from then on,” Ms Ley said.
